Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: incorrectKeys(invalidElements:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Some elements were presented that do not fit our keys. The associated value is an Array of the failing keys.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: valuesNotPlistCompatible(invalidElements:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Not all of the elements in the _values Dictionary are Plist-Compatible. The associated value is an Array of the failing keys.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: noStoredPrefsForKey(key:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: We were not able to find a stored pref for the given key. The associated value is the key we are looking for.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: unknownError(error:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Unknown thrown error. The associated value is the error (if any).

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: _values
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: This is the Dictionary. It’s private, and shouldn’t need to be accessed outside this base class.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: _save()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: This is a private method that saves the current contents of the _values Dictionary to persistent storage, keyed by the value of the “key” property.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: _load()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: This is a private method that reads in the data from persistent storage for this instance (using the “key” property), and loads the _values Dictionary property.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: PrefsError
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Errors that Can be thrown from methods in this class

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: groupID
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: This is used to specify an App Group ID, if the prefs are shared within an app.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: key
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: This is the key that is used to store and fetch the collection of data to be used to populate the _values Dictionary.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: lastError
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: This is any error that was thrown during a save or a load. May be nil.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: keys
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: This calculated property MUST be overridden by subclasses.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.name: values
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.abstract: This is an accessor for the _values Dictionary. Before it returns the Dictionary, it loads data from persistent storage.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: subscript(_:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: This is a direct-access subscript that allows you to use the prefs object to reach its stored properties.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.name: init()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.abstract: The default initializer uses the current subclass typename as the main key.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: init(key:values:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: You can initialize instances with a key and some initial data values.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: flush()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: This clears the values, and flushes the cache. It then reloads the values.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: clear()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: This clears the values, and flushes the cache, but does not load.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.name: deleteAll()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:19RV.abstract: This deletes all prefs, including saved ones.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html.name: RVS_PersistentPrefs
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html.abstract: This class is meant to act as an “abstract” base class, providing a simple Dictionary datastore that is stored in the UserDefaults in the Application Bundle. It is designed to be reliable, and extremely simple to use.
